intro: Prismatomeris neurophylla, commonly known as the silky flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and supporting local biodiversity.
